بسم اللّه الرّحمن الرّحيم
أطال اللّه بقاك وأدام عزّك وكرامتك وتأييدك وسعادتك وأتم نعمه علــيك
وزاد في إحسانه إليك في الدّنيا والآخرة من برحمته خير ø وصــلّى اللّه على محمّد النّبي وعليه السّلم
أعلمك أكرمـك اللّه أنّي قد كتبت إليك من الكتب ما لا أحصيها أذكر لك
فيها أمر محمّد ولدي وما نزل في بي من مصيبة ولم أرا لك كتاب
ولا خبر ولقد غمّني أمرك وبعد فلا أدري يصل كتــابي والدّنانير فأسل اللّه
أن لا يريك في من أحببت مكروه أحب تعلم أعزّك اللّه أنّه غمّني أمر خبرك
إذا لم يأتني تأتي متخبّر فتخبر عــليــك فواللّه يا أخي إلّا ممّا عجّلت عــليه بجواب كتابي هذا حليــت
به نفسي وقد اتضايقــت أبصرت أنّك عليك عليل لأي فغمّني ذلك فأســأل اللّه أن لا يــري فيك مكروه
أنّه يــتمتّع الــ الإجابة وقد ويســ كتابي
وبها نــســتعيذ فإن شا اللّه عــ
خبره أحسن اللّه عزاك وأخلد وأخلف عزّك عليك في فهو الـ
ألّا إلّا ســ أحد ــها الــ أعلمه اعلمه الـ
ـك كنت أحب ألّا تدفع تدع الكتاب بخبرك وحالك وجوابــك وحوائجك
فإنّي أسر بذلك عليك منّي أفضل السّلم وأطيــبــه وعلى جميع من قبلك
السّلــم كثيرا أطال الــلّه بقاك وأدام عزّك وكرامتك وتأييدك وسعادتك
وصلّى اللّه على محمّد النّبي وســلّم تسليم حسبنا اللّه ونعم الوكيل
لأبي عثمان أدام اللّه عزّه وكرامته من أحمد أخيه بن أبي الأسود تدفع بلّغ إليه
أسعــدك وليّ عند عبد اللّه وحسبنا وسعادته اللّه ø
المرة أن تخرج إليكم في السّلم
واسعدها عپد وولدها

In the name of God the merciful and compassionate. In the name of God, the merciful، and compassionate.
May God prolong your life, may he preserve your strength, your honour, your support and your happiness, may he bestow upon you a full measure of his bounty May God prolong your life! May he preserve your strength, your honour, your support and your happiness! May he bestow upon you a full measure of his bounty
and increase His goodness to you in this world and the next! God bless Muhammad the prophet and upon him be peace! and may he increase his goodness to you in this world and the next. God bless Muḥammad the prophet and upon him be peace.
(I am writing to) let you know - may God show you kindness - that I have written to you innumerable letters, in which I told you about (I am writing to) let you know - May God show you kindness! - that I have written to you innumerable letters, in which I told you about
the affair of Muḥammad, my boy, and the affliction which has befallen me. I have not seen any letter of yours the affair of Muhammad, my boy, and the affliction which has befallen me. I have not seen any letter of yours,
nor (have I heard) any news and I am concerned about you. Now, I do not know whether my letter and the dīnārs will arrive. I pray to God
that he will not cause you to see anything unpleasant afflict those whom you love. I should like you to know - may God give you strength - that I am worried about you. that He will not cause you to see anything unpleasant afflict those whom you love. I should like you to know - May God give you strength! - that I am worried about you.
If we hear no more news from you than what you hasten to write in reply to this letter of min I shall be pleased. If we hear no more news from you than what you quickly write in reply to this letter of min I shall be pleased. Wenn Du nicht kommst, dann gib (doch wenigstens) Nachricht.
... ich habe (jetzt) deutlich erkannt, daß Du krank bist (sc. weil Du nicht schreibst); dies hat mich betrübt. ... It distresses me that you find this a burden. I pray to God that he does not cause me to see anything unpleasant concerning you.
[...] he enjoys [...] ... reply [...] ... my letter...
... God willing...
... Gott gebe Dir guten Trost und gewähre Dir Ersatz. ... [...] his news [...] may God give you good consolation and preserve your strength [...] ... he...
... ich hätte gern, daß Du es nicht unterläßt, zu schreiben, wie es mit Dir steht, wie es Dir geht und welche Anliegen Du hast. ... I should like you not to hand the letter [to ... tell me your news] and how you are, and your reply
denn ich würde mich darüber freuen. ... [so that] I should have pleasure in that. The very best wishes from me to you, and also the very best wishes to every one who is with you. [so that] I should have pleasure in that. The very best wishes from me to you, and also to every one who is with you
May God prolong your life, and may He preserve your strength, honour, support and happiness! the very best wishes. May God prolong your life and may he preserve your strength, honour, support and happiness.
God [bless] Muḥammad, the prophet, and save him. Our sufficiency is in God and in him we like to trust. God [bless] Muhammad the Prophet and save him! Our sufficiency is God, and in Him we like to trust.
To ʾAbū ʿUṯmān, may God preserve his strength and honour, from ʾAḥmad ibn al-ʾAswad, deliver [...] convey to him the message: To Abu ʿUthman - May God preserve his strength and honour! - from Ahmad ibn al-Aswad.
'May God [help] you in it'. Our sufficiency is God.
[...] the woman to go to you...
and (God) help her and her son Muḥammad in it.
